Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, straight across the road from the tram stop so very easy to find, you get your own key to come and go as you please, staff are very friendly and our room was spacious had everything we needed, was clean and beds very comfy. No noise from outside so got a great sleep, couldn't fault the hotel at all. Would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Affordable, In a Lively Part of Town, Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: Doodyjazz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Plantage is located in the "Plantage Middenlaan" part of town. Right across from the Artis (zoo), very easy to get to by tram, bus, or water taxi. The rooms are average to large in size according to Amsterdam standards, and are kept very clean. What you will get here is a nice room in a quiet neighborhood, with a clean bed and bathroom. What more do you need? If you plan on spending your whole trip in a hotel room this may not be the place for you, but if you are an adventurer and just need a crash pad, this is perfect. I can't believe one reviewer said the location isn't great, they couldn't be more wrong. This part of town has everything, if not more, than any other part of town, and it isn't as crowded as some of the other central areas. Very close by you will find many restaurants; Turkish, Italian (great pizza), Chinese, Indian, Indonesian, Thai, French, and Dutch. Also a bakery, butcher shop, super market, and milk shop. There are also several first rate attractions right outside the front door; The Artis (zoo), the Resistance Museum, Werthiem Park, the Hortus Botanicus, and the University of Amsterdam. Also within walking distance is the Rembrandthuis Museum (where Rembrandt lived). There are several cafes to choose from; Eik en Linde, Tros Muziek Cafe, and right on the corner (the street level floor of the building) is the wonderful Cafe Koosje. Down the street towards the Hortus Botanicus is also one of the best coffeeshops in town, Het Ballonettje. Every room has a private shower/bathroom, color TV, hair dryer, safe, and a fridge. There is also fresh coffee and soft drinks available in the lobby, plus internet, telephone, and fax service. All in all, Hotel Plantage is a good bargain for your buck, especially in this part of town, just down the street there are rooms that go for twice as much. Not a luxury type of place, but you will be comfortable and save a lot of money by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodation”
Reviews.Author: SKDLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Plantage in October with a group staying in 4 rooms. The rooms vary greatly in size and layout - my room didn't have a wardrobe others had a lobby as well as main room and bathroom. This is a very basic hotel - the bedlinen, showers and towels were clean but don't look took closely at the carpets and curtains. If you can arrive during the day - the evening reception service was very unhelpful and inflexible - you also have to pay upfront which doesn't inspire confidence. On the plus side it is a quieter part of town but with good tram routes into the centre. Downstairs Cafe Koosje was a nice place for breakfast and good for an evening drink. But in a smaller group you could probably find a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you think it is going to be”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: Tiny attic room 34 has 2 airplane sized windows and an extremely tiny bathroom built into the roof so you can't even stand up. The pot smoking in the hallway didn't class this creaky flop house up either. And the location isn't great. You can find something better.

Reviews.Title: “anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: 551897Christine1961
Reviews.Content: hotel plantage basic but clean ten minutes from central station tram 9 every thing you need if you need anything just ask very helpfull staff speak good english. good pub under hotel serve breakfast lunch and dinner bakers cross road amsterdam itself very pricey could do with a bit paint but what you pay is cheap if you want 5star then you have to pay more would recomend for cheap weekend away

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: seelemonde
Reviews.Content: Staying in Amsterdam is expensive, but if youâ€™re looking for a place that is a step up from a hostel, still fairly central and reasonably priced â€“ this place fits the bill. The rooms are fine and you can walk or take the conveniently located tram into the city centre. I did have some problems with my reservation as they had mistakenly booked the room I had paid for to someone else. Luckily there was another room available â€“ but the hotel did try to blame me for the problem, even though I proved it was their mistake. There was also a noisy stag group staying next door, so not ideal for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money you pay”
Reviews.Author: Chucklesg
Reviews.Content: Where to start just got back from Amsterdam, me and my boyfriend decided to stop at the plantage as it had some good reviews and looked clean and comfortable on the websites pictures. When we arrived at the hotel we were told our room wouldnt be ready till 1'clock we arrived at 10.00am and had no where to leave our cases. In the end we had to leave them in reception when we did eventually get into our room the curtains were stained and were hanging half off of the pole, there were also stains on the carpet and walls look nothing like the photos shown. My boyfriend decided to have a shower which ended up with the bathroom n room flooded as the drain in the shower was blocked n caused the bathroom to flood. I told the owner who tryed to get a plumber out to look at it as he tryed to unblock it himself. In the end the blockage couldnt be unblocked n we had to look at moving to another hotel. The owner refunded us the amount that we payed and the extra money towards stopping in another hotel, in the end we stopped at the France hotel which was right in the centre of Amsterdam n was well worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at an affordable price. You want 5 star, then pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: RubyRoberts
Reviews.Content: Just got back home from Hotel Plantage. Lovely building. Stairs are steep, but hey, aren't they all in Amsterdam. You don't like that, then don't book it. Room service IS available upon request. You don't request it, you don't get it - don't complain. The peace and quiet is nice anyhow. Room was fresh. Shower is strange, but floor mop is left for you to swill the water down drain. You don't do this, then it will flood - common sense! Guy on reception was very pleasant and helpful. Drinks and snack machine in reception, which is good. Leaflets on trips in reception, which is good. Why do some people complain about a low star hotel, expect to receive 5 star treatment, is beyond me!? We were supposed to be staying in the attic room, howevver, but were given room 22, which was fine. A little dated, but hey, that's different isn't it? It's only a 10 to 15 minute walk from the city centre. If you don't like this, then book a nearer hotel - don't complain. However, there are lots of trams and buses available on the street. The people of Amsterdam of very friendly, and the staff in this hotel were very friendly. There is wifi through the building, if you take ipod or laptop, which is great. There is also free internet in reception. This DOES work, ignore people who say it doesn't. There are NOT marks all over the walls at all. The hotel is clean, private and very quiet at night. There's a cracking chinese across the road! Check this out! I would definitely stay here again, no problem. If you have trouble walking up steep stairs, as I say, perhaps you should try and find a hotel that doesn't have steep stairs. It is NOT a dirty hotel. Ignore these horrible reviews. Generally, you pay for what you get anywhere, so don't complain. If you take the time to read the booklet also, which is left in all rooms, you will see that the hotel CAN provide room service if you so wish, you just need to book it the day before - not a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: bluedahlia
Reviews.Content: This year it has been my third visit to this great hotel...it is cheap in price, not too far from the Amsterdam attractions, and it is a place where you can almost feel at home. We have always booked the attic room, which is very roomy, and it has a very big window which allows a nice light inside, as well as good ventilation...it is allowd to smoke inside these rooms, so keeping the air fresh is important, not only for us, but also because of the smell that can be stored in, The minibar is empty but you can buy anything you need from a supermarket that is nearby (you also get a discount badge with your room keys), you have an iron and ironing table in the room, which for us is important, the shower has good pressure and temperature, and the cleaning service to the room is up to you...if you want it, you ask for it. In our case, we were there for three days, so it wasn't really needed...and that's also part of what gives that "at home" feel, besides one of the receptionists who recognized us from our previous stays and it is absolutely kind. The only bad thing I can think of is the stairs...but that is something that is common to most of Amsterdam's hotels I believe...and part of its architectural heritage, so it is something you need to shrug about.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews ...”
Reviews.Author: wasgeht
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a great choice because we started looking for accommodation quite late. And we wanted to believe the 50% that gave the hotel an ok review. The staff was ok, rather helpful at the beginning, but they also made it clear that there will not be any room service, only when requested. The location is actually great, but the rest is just filthy. Our bathroom had loads of mould-stains and layers of filth everywhere, one couldn't regulate the temperature of the shower, when you had a shower the whole bathroom was flooded. In the actual room there was a giant bin next to the bed, dust everywhere. All sorts of stains on the wall. The bed sheets had sure been washed, but if you wash bed sheets at a low temperature or do not get new ones for decades then nasty stains will remain. The carpet ... we don't know how old it was .... but we kept our flipflops on in the bathroom and the actual room at all times. The room got really hot as well, although the temperatures in June are not that extreme and we didn't have a room under the roof. In addition it is rather noisy outside due to the cafe downstairs and the tram. But this would have been ok. We think it's a shame that a hotel like this, that has not been renovated, painted over or just spend any money on - will still get booked because of the hotel situation in Amsterdam. AVOID staying there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed - Accused of Blackmail by Staff!”
Reviews.Author: bedeviledegg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 34 -- one of the attic rooms. The hotel and location are very neat. It's a little outside the hustle of the city, yet still close enough. The building is old, giving it a lot of character. That's the only nice things I can say. The room was filthy. There were bugs on the sheets. There were marks all over the walls. There was hair and other stuff left from the previous occupant. The drain didn't work, leaving an inch of water across the bathroom floor (the floor is all tile, and no separation for the shower). And on top of all that, the staff accused me of blackmail. We had traveled to Amsterdam from Germany. This hotel was a sort of last resort as everything was either booked up, or more than 120 euros per night. Because of this, we dealt with the room and its problems. But I took photos (I've posted them here, but haven't seen them show up yet). Upon checkout, I showed the staff the photos of our room. At first they seemed concerned, calling it a "major" problem. Then when I asked for a refund, things turned for the worse. The staff took on an attitude that I was trying to scam them. "The spider could have flown in through an open window." "Why did you wait until morning to tell us these problems?" "Now you are here trying to blackmail us." "If you saw poor reviews, why did you book with us?" Yes, I traveled more than 5,000 miles to Amsterdam to blackmail a small hotel. [/sarcasm] It was surreal. The staff was blaming the problems on the guest for not being more vigilant in selecting the hotel. The fact that there were bugs, a filthy room, and a bathroom drain that didn't work were normal. It was us, the guests, that were at fault. On the plus side, after talking to the owner, I wasn't offered a refund, but I was offered a discounted room on my next stay! Absolutely laughable. Save the trouble -- take a look at the photos I've attached here and book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: FlameLady
Reviews.Content: This stay was very pleasant and if I'm ever going back to Amsterdam, I'd like to stay there again. The location is very convenient, just few stops form the very centre, the staff is very friendly, room was very clean and had a huge bathroom. The only disadvantage is, however, that the hotel doesn't provide any breakfast or food in general.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: becka_j_h
Reviews.Content: On this occaision I feel the need to imform any other person who is looking at staying here! I have been to Amsterdam on numerous occasions so I know what to expect in regards to the general budget hotels in around the city but this by far the worst place I have ever stayed! Dont get it twisted Im not high maintance but you do expect the basic hospitality even if the hotel states that you will recieve more. On arrival we were allocated to the attic room. The recpetionist explained we would not recieve any housekeeping in this room, and if you wanted a clean towel you come down down and ask.This room was like a cupboard! 3m by 4m. No bigger. Out of the 5 lights (5!) 1 worked! There were extention cable everywhere! All in all 20 electric points (20!) There was a roof window so you had no view and it didnt shut properly, though there was a little space heater!! It was dirty, damp and smelt like a stale coffeeshop. There was a tv at the end of a bed on top of a stool. I knocked this over entering the room. The bathroom was foul, it had no ventilation the ceiling was covered in mould, when the shower was on it was easiest to sit on the toilet to shower (!) The bathroom door was filty rotten and slimey! 2 night we got back and the there was no electric which meant our room was pitch black! All the hotel guy was saying was it wasnt his fault but I was not willing to stay in there as it was cold and pitch black In the end I got allocated to another room with a window so we had a bit of light from the night lights outside, this room on the other was OK, it was a dam sight cleaner and certainly bearable which raises the question why were we put in this cupboard in the first place when you pay for a double room. He didnt understand any of what I was telling him (or did he) This room was loud though til 3 in the morning no sleep when you ave to leave at 6 am pissed off was a understatement. If you use this hotel make sure you request you do not stay in the cupboard up top! And if you do dont say I didnt warn you!!! YUCK! oh and the hotel internet! Dosent work!! Dont bother!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny.”
Reviews.Author: Foxtravler
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in mid October for a getaway. We stayed in the top attic room. The view was breathtaking! Plantage Kerklaan is a beautiful little neighborhood. Quite busy during the day and very peaceful in the evening. The tram (9 & 14) picks up directly outside the hotel. Also, there is an ATM right outside, along with some great restaurants. The hotel service was wonderful. They do housekeeping based on your request, which is perfect in my opinion! They were very friendly, as well. If you're a wimp about carrying your own luggage or climbing many stairs, this place is not for you. If you plan on staying out late and enjoying the finer parts of Amsterdam, don't worry about not finding your hotel! This hotel is in a very convenient neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hotel...”
Reviews.Author: fawky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2009. We had a lot of trouble finding the hotel initially and it's so hard to navigate in Amsterdam, especially when you've just arrived. First impression of the hotel was so-so... when we stayed there, the owner was a large man and he had a staff member helping him out. Both were friendly, but the staff member much more friendly, he spoke great English and had lots of advice and tips to offer us. There was free internet in the reception area which was handy. There was also plenty of vending machines in the reception area which I'm sure come in quite handy for some... To get to our room, it was a steep descent up the very narrow flight of stairs. This was incredibly difficult with a backpack on - I thought I was going to topple backwards! The room was okay, clean enough I suppose. Although we did decide to pull our sleeping bags and pillowcases out of our backpacks and use them instead of sleep in the Plantage beds. The bathroom was a little weird, they supply a tub of liquid soap but we didn't use that. There was no shower curtain so everything got wet, even the toilet. Speaking of the toilet, it had one of those weird glass seats with shells etc in it. I'm just glad it wasn't one that had spiders in it. Thought it was broken and you had to hop on and off again very carefully. The neighbourhood itself is lovely. It's leafy, busy with families, a short stroll into the heart of Amsterdam. We felt extremely safe at night time. There was a little cafe below Plantage which did good coffee and tea and breakfasts in the morning. On our last day, Plantage held our bags for us free of charge as we weren't leaving Amsterdam until that night on the overnight train up to Copenhagen. All in all, I wouldn't stay at Plantage again, but it was fine for what we needed I think. It worked out to be about $60 AUD per night which was well within our budget at the time.

Reviews.Title: “15 minutes from madness. Great place to start. Going back soon.”
Reviews.Author: fillymac
Reviews.Content: This is opposite the Zoo 15 minutes walk from the Bulldog x3. Nice walk to the main squares., Supermarket very close by, Cigarette shop opposite the hotel. Good staff, very friendly. Room 15 is the best room in the house. Overlooks a crossroads of bikes cars and trams. Tram No. 9 takes you from hotel to Dam Sq. in 9 stops. â‚¬2.60 for an hours ticket. Go to the Bulldog and see Adon, Joneele and Krista for the best breakfast and garlic tomatoes......mmmmmmmmmmm .........

Reviews.Title: “Grate value for good service”
Reviews.Author: bill2create
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in the Small Twin attic room. All facilities available like shower/toilet,TV, fridge etc. . Room is small but charming. The name of the room says about the size. Nice area with a lot of restaurants, city zoo, close to all attractions. Friendly people in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One saving grace - the location”
Reviews.Author: drarbeit
Reviews.Content: Hotel Plantage is in the Plantage are of Amsterdam. That is the great part. It's quiet, non-touristy, full of great cafes and restaurant and really well connected. You can walk into the main part of town in about 20 min. The bad part is eerything else. The rooms are FILTHY. The carpetting rotten, the bathrooms have no shower cabin so you actually have to leave all your clothes in the room because they'll get wet, when you shower as will the toilet and everything else. The stairs are very narrow and steep. We travelled only with hand luggage and still had a really hard time negotiating our baggage - no, nobody helps you. This is a hotel that costs â‚¬80 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoSSack_Don
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very close to the center and all usual amusements. Friendly stuff, allowed us to leave the luggage after the check out. As our flight was in the evening it helps us a lot. We had some extra time to spend in the city. Surely will be back with the friends.

Reviews.Title: “+5”
Reviews.Author: Julia_Dreams
Reviews.Content: Hotel Plantage very close to the Artis Zoo, just in front of it, and only 5 minutes walking distance from the Hortus Batanicus Park (hope that I wrote it correct ;-)) Not far from the Amsterdam Central Station, just 15 to 20 minutes walking distance, but we took the tram becouse of our small kids, otherwise we could walk. Beauteful city. defenetly will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Plantage is cheap and you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: amarith1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and they have painted and recarpeted the stairs, (they were doing it whilst I was there). Stayed in the attic room which was grand except the shower didn't drain properly. Otherwise staff were friendly and tolerant as normal even though there were 12 of us on a stag do. Overall. Unpretentious accomodation and friendly and informative staff but don't expect perfection and marble floors.....!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Tozop
Reviews.Content: Last monday we stayed for one night in hotel Plantage. The hotel is situated in a nice neighbourhood close to the centre of Amsterdam (near the Waterloo square en the zoo Artis). At first it looked a bit strange to enter the hotel starting with stairs, but after that we arrived in a nice hotel with a lot of doors and stairs, which gave it it's own charm. The bedroom was nice with toilet and shower, good beds en that for a very reasonable price! The 'tram' was just outside the door and underneath the hotel on the first floor/ground floor there was an authentic cafe where we drunk something in the evening. In the morning we had a good breakfast there! Service was good. To be short: we were supprised to find such a good hotel for this price! Ton Zopfi.

Reviews.Title: “would reconmend,”
Reviews.Author: patrickdargan
Reviews.Content: the hotel was less than 10 minutes walk from central station, and literally no more than 100 yards from the city zoo(artis). and tram stop rite outside. also a bar underneath but even with windows open, heard no noise from. the service was fantastic and the staff we found bent over backwards to help and make sure we had a good time in amsterdam. the only thing that let us down was the fact it was twin beds and not a double. other than that for the price it was above and beyond expectation for a hotel this price in main land europe. will defo be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night but thats about it!”
Reviews.Author: FayeEu
Reviews.Content: The Plantage took some locating as we opted to lug our suitcases round most of Amsterdam instead of getting the tram to straight outside the hotel (big mistake) The location is ideal, just a few minutes to Dam Square, red light area and the tourist shops and bars. We got let in via the intercom outside and had to drag our luggage up some (dirty) stairs. May not be ideal to bring lots of bags etc as there were a lot of steps, but this was nothing we couldn't take care of ourselves. We were greeted by a friendly middle aged man at reception who took our money and gave us a bit of info on the area, seemed quite nice but I agree with another reviewer, although the staff were welcoming they were quite 'odd'! There is a little coffee machine in there so handy if you want something to take up to your room. Word of warning: Don't take a leaflet off the desk, they smell of manure and after taking a few up to our room we had to fumigate the place with half a can of Impulse. THE ROOM: Right, where do I start? First off, the layout of this hotel is very un-nerving, although a beautiful building, it is very higgledy-piggledy inside. We were in the attic room and didn't feel very safe at all, high up at the top of the building with no views of other buildings, people etc. For two girls barely over 20 we would of liked to have been somewhere where we could sense civilisation, as we felt very isolated and unsafe. The rooms decor doesn't help u relax either!Our room was painted in the brightest red I've ever seen with grafitti spotted about the place, and overall had a really eerie feel. Since the hotel was only for one nights kip we weren't too bothered, but the shower facility was a bit of a joke, its true that you could brush your teeth, have a shower and go for a wee all at the same time! As for the reviewers who said it was 'fantastic' etc all I can say is what is wrong with you?! YES it is a cheap hotel and doesnt claim to be a five star or anything, but we weren't expecting to feel unsafe and the room to be vandalised and musty. Overall it is fine for a (very) short stay if all your wanting is a bed, but I would advise people with claustrophobia and young women to stay away if they like to feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cheap accomodation”
Reviews.Author: matt059
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel above average. rooms were clean and relatively large for any European hotel. we were staying on the third floor and yes there are a few stairs but its Europe!! reception staff were friendly and more than willing to help. hotel has free wi-fi which was great. really good location - short walk to supermarket and restaurants, tram line to city centre less than 2 minutes walk away. no noise from pub below at all, even with window open all night. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rich069
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel , terrible , the room was smelly and in a poor state of decoration . I also did not find the price at all budget, especially considering how poor the accommodation is. I am not fussy ,it really is bad!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say...”
Reviews.Author: AussieBlonde-ee
Reviews.Content: Not sure where other people stayed... i don't think it was Hotel Plantage... The guys in the reception couldn't have been nicer. Check-in was at 2 but we got there at about 11am... We were just going to drop our bags and run but the guy said our room could be ready in about 10 mins. So we paid what was due PLUS CITY TAX of 5%... This is not included in the price of Amsterdam hotels and whatever website you booked through should have informed you of this. We got a printed receipt so maybe you should ask for one if it's that much of a problem. While waiting the guy gave us â‚¬1 each for a coffee/soft drink and we checked our emails on the free internet. At no point thriughout the whole stay did anyone in reception smoke anything. When the room was ready we went up to the top floor and dropped our stuff. Sure the stairs are steep but so are ALL THE STAIRS IN THE CITY!!! IT'S AMSTERDAM!!! Try any other hotel and you'll experience exactly the same thing. If you want an elevator then DON'T GO TO AMSTERDAM!!! We had the small twin attic room on the top floor, my only complaint would be the same as i saw in a previous review... the drain in the toilet really smelt! EW! We were told if we wanted the room cleaned to inform staff before 12pm on the day but we only stayed 3 nights so we didn't require new towels etc. The free internet was mostly always free, you receive a key to come and go as you please, the bar below is SO NOT ROWDY! We went in and it was a nice quiet restaurant. Not too far out from all the action, about a 10min walk or probably a 2min tram ride. We had a big window we kept open most of the time. This is a fine place to stay, and we had the smell of poo to deal with throughout most our stay (don't stay in the small twin attic room!)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: JANEBCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was one of the wost hotels we stayed at. The staff was the most threatening, rude, and criminal minded. He took more money from us that was agreed with Hotels.com and did not provide a receipt. He was taking advantage of several customers that were white Americans, I think. Room was not clean, straight out of a junk yard set-up, winding stairs made it impossible to get the luggage up to the rooms and no help with it either from the hotel staff, bed sheets were dirty as if some had used them before we got there and had urine spots, carpet was infected with mold and bugs, red bed bugs were under the sheets and in the mattress, entire hotel was filled with smoke, no a/c and no windows in the room, absolutely unsafe location due to a hoodlum bar underneath the hotel, and building design, if you are a women or with a women definitely do not stay here, and staff was always smoking joint and cigarettes. It is better to stay in any hotel than this one because no other place could be any worse. I think the owner is from middle east and hates foreigners in general, but Americans in particular. I have pictures to prove the condition of the hotel and the room. There are several other reviews on this cite that have experience similar to ours. JB, California, USA

Reviews.Title: “Plantage Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: u2bblond
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Plantage for the taste of old Amsterdam. I didn't go in blindly expecting room service to bring tea to my room everyday. Yes, the stairs are steep, but I would hate to see them gut the building to install a lift. I prefer the old world charm as it is. I was in an attic room, so I understand the stairs. The room was clean and airy. Internet was in the reception, so not good for business travel if you have to be on line every second of the day. Other patrons were respectful enough not to monopolize it. No problems. Staff was incredible. Very helpful and great to chat with. Anyone thinking otherwise should perhaps check their own attitudes. It was a short walk to all the shops and Central. Maps and coupons are provided in the reception. The tram drops you off in front of the hotel. The cafe under the hotel had great food. I did a lot of research before booking and found the Hotel Plantage exactly what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Put this hotel in low priority”
Reviews.Author: flaneuse23
Reviews.Content: The room is not clean. The water got obstructed when I took a shower. Though the price looks cheap, but without breakfast, so actually is not cheap. For female solo traveller, I would suggest not choose this hotel. I didn't feel secure with the design of the space of the building. The locaiton is not bad if you wanna visit Hollandsche Schouwburg and the windmill.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: petizamia
Reviews.Content: First of all, we were on a budget. Any way you see it, Amsterdam hotels are down right expensive. Second of all, It's very difficult to find accomodations for four in one room so our choices were limited. But we didn't expect such eeky room. The bathroom had a smelly vent, the furniture was old but functional, the rug was old and filthy and room repairs were hodge-podge. Nice, helpful staff (all male); they're trying hard but it's in need of serious updating. Beautiful neighborhood and coffee shop next door was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: h0lly12
Reviews.Content: First impressions were bad. The staircase up to the hotel was old, tattered and dangerous, but once past that, the rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Staff were helpful and friendly: Our hairdryer broke and it was replaced straight away. I wouldnt recommend this hotel for fussy people, but if you're young and want a chep place to stay in a central location, come here.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff - a good cheap base to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KA-Wivenhoe
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t know where previous respondents stayed, but it doesnâ€™t sound like the same place! We spent some time there from 9th July. A 10 minute walk south is the wonderful Oosterpark. About 12 minutes walk in the other direction gets you to Dam Square. Failing walking, regular trams stop within 50 yards of the door. The staff could not be faulted. We were welcomed, they often chatted when we passed the reception, and were very helpful with our queries on our plans for the day. Nikolei's English was excellent. There was no hint of any additional charges, no rudeness, in fact â€“ the opposite. OK â€“ the stairs are steep, and some things could perhaps do with a coat of paint. But, itâ€™s a two star hotel, and the plans are to add rooms, re-decorate, and to add a lift. Until then, the Ritz it isnâ€™t, but the rooms and facilities are adequate and for the location, exceptionally cheap. If you want more, then pay Â£120 per night and choose somewhere different. For a good cheap base to explore Amsterdam, there is nothing wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: moonshine30
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend with some friends here . Upon arrival the receptionist was rude and literally barked the hotel rules at us . The room was awful as well full of furniture and other objects that appear to have been stolen from other hotels . Anyway we decided to head out on Friday night and check out Amsterdam at night which was brilliant . The following morning we were woken abrubtly by the same rude little man this time accusing us defecating on the stairs of the hotel and demanding cash otherwise we would be thrown out . When he showed us the scene of the crime there wasn't even a bad smell from the incident which had supposedly only happened a couple of hours earlier - not even a smell of bleach - of course none of us had performed such an act . However we had no chice but to pay up as all the other hotels/hostels were either fully booked or far too expensive . Needless to say we saw the money go straight into his pocket without even any sign of a receipt being written. A warning to anyone thinking of staying here - spend a bit extra and stay somewhere else as it will cost you more in the long run when you get ripped off !!! Ripped Off - London

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: cov1
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel; awful rooms; rude and surly staff who try and rip off their customers. This place's one redeeming feature is the fact that its cheap - but you have been warned...

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, no hesitation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault this hotel for value and service. In an excellent location, right next to the Tram Stop. Rooms very comfortable and clean, staff extremely friendly. Cannot understand why people have complained - you get what you pay for. In our case, we paid very little and got an excellent room. No signs of mould or smell. We would without a doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, dirty, and tattered”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The "hotel" is a nightmare. If you are a poor student or someone who likes youth hostels, then I guess it's OK. (Then again, at more than $70 per night, it's no bargain). The hotel is small, dirty, with a steep winding staircase and no elevator. The smells of smoke and body odor are overwhelming. The "shower" is in the toilette. On the positive side, the staff is friendly and accomodating, and the neighborhood is good.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were angry at first, because we couldn't check in until about 4PM. However, our room was very spacious, private bathroom, blow dryer, hot plate, refrigerator, safe, TV with many channels. The only problems were the stairs, as are always steep and curving in Amsterdam, and the staff did not speak very good English. Also, our room was never made up, no new towels, etc. Worth the price for location and amenities though.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Plantage
HotelInfo.Address: Plantage Kerklaan 25, Amsterdam 1018 CV, The Netherlands
